intro: Euphrasia pectinata subsp. alpina, commonly known as the Alpine eyebright, is a flowering plant native to alpine regions of Europe. It is characterized by its small, yellowish-orange flowers and hairy, succulent leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is known for its medicinal properties. Its delicate structure and ability to thrive in harsh environments make it a notable species in mountain ecosystems.
